title: PREPARATION OR PRETREATMENT OF THE MATERIAL TO BE SHAPED; MAKING GRANULES OR PREFORMS; RECOVERY OF PLASTICS OR OTHER CONSTITUENTS OF WASTE MATERIAL CONTAINING PLASTICS
informative_references: Mixing in generalGranulating in generalSolid waste disposal
special_rules: In this subclass, it is desirable to add the Indexing Codes of subclasses Reference is further made to the special rule of classification in the field of  as far as the application of Indexing Codes as provided in  and  is concerned.Products per se are not classified in this subclass. However, if a product is characterised by the way it is produced and not by its structure or composition, the production method should be classified in this subclass.Inventive and additional information disclosed in documents to be classified should be identified by allocation the appropriate classification symbols provided in . In particular attention should be paid to the so called break down Indexing Codes, forming a further subdivision of a group or a subgroup, which are only present at additional information level.
glossary_of_terms: A plasticis defined as a macromolecular compound or composition based on such a compound.In a plastic staterefers to a state in which the material is more or less easily deformable, locally or as a whole, by force in any direction, to assume and retain any desired shape.
definition_statement: This place covers: The mechanical preparation of plastic material as raw material used in subsequent plastic shaping techniques which form a final product ( ,  ,   and  ). The making of preforms used as an intermediate product which will udergo an additional processing step, e.g. blow moulding, to obtain the final product ( ). The recovery of plastics from waste products in order to reuse it for making new products ( ).

title: Mixing; Kneading  ({for preparation of dough A21C1/00;} in general B01F; combined with calendering B29C43/24, with injection B29C45/46, with extrusion B29C48/36)
informative_references: Extrusion of plastics
special_rules: In this subclass, as a general rule, the type of plastic mixer is to be specified, as well as the specific structural elements which are characteristic of this kind of device.Additional details of the mixing or kneading device for which no specific classification information can be found in  are classified under the corresponding sub-groups of  (mixing in general).
definition_statement: This place covers: Devices for the preparation of plastics, this preparation only concerning the mechanical aspects of it, i.e. the mixing of the individual components to obtain a homogeneous mass and/or its subsequent mechanical kneading to achieve the desired consistency.

title: Making granules  (in general B01J; chemical aspects C08J3/12)
definition_statement: This place covers: the mechanical preparation of granules, pellets made of plastic material as raw material and used in subsequent plastic shaping techniques which form a final product. The plastic materials concerned by this subclass are polymeric materials used in the subclasses  .

title: by dividing preformed material
informative_references: Cutting aspects of dividing the preformed materialDevelopers with toner particles; preparation methods

title: in the form of plates or sheets
informative_references: Disintegrating by knives or other cutting or tearing members which chop material into fragments, specially adapted for disintegrating plastics,
definition_statement: This place covers: Illustrative example of subject matter classified in  .

title: in the form of filamentary material, e.g. combined with extrusion
informative_references: Disintegrating by knives or other cutting or tearing members which chop material into fragments, specially adapted for desintegrating plastics , Multi-port extrusion nozzles
definition_statement: This place covers: Illustrative example of subject matter classified in  .

title: {under-water, e.g. underwater pelletizers}
definition_statement: This place covers: The methods and devices for the preparation of granules, pellets made of plastic material as raw material wherein the cutting operation is performed right after extrusion in a water box. Underwater pelletizer includes also the use of other liquids to cool down the extruded plastic material. Illustrative example of subject matter classified in  .

title: by agglomerating smaller particles
definition_statement: This place covers: Illustrative example of subject matter classified in  . US-A-2011/0109013

title: by moulding the material, i.e. treating it in the molten state
informative_references: Granulating material in general; by dividing the liquid material into drops, e.g. by spraying, and solidifying the dropsGranulating material in general; by dividing the liquid material into drops,in a gaseous mediumGranulating material in general; by dividing the liquid material into drops,in a liquid medium
definition_statement: This place covers: The methods and devices for the preparation of granules, pellets made of plastic material as raw material wherein no preformed material (e.g. plates, sheets, filamentary matrial as in   or  ) is used. The granules are made by moulding. Illustrative example of subject matter classified in  .

title: characterised by structure or composition
definition_statement: This place covers: The methods and devices for the mechanical preparation of granules made of plastic material as raw material wherein the granules are defined by their physical structure (e.g. multilayer or compartimentalized granule) or by their composition (e.g. the selection of the granule ingredients has an influence on the method and apparatus used to manufacture the granule). The documents disclosing only the chemical composition of granules and wherein the mechanical preparation is absent or trivial are classified in  . Illustrative example of subject matter classified in  .

title: fibre-reinforced
informative_references: Pretreatment of reinforcement; coating or impregnating of reinforcements of indefinite length with a matrix in liquid form, e.g. as melt, solution or latex
definition_statement: This place covers: The methods and devices for the preparation of granules, pellets made of plastic material as raw material wherein the granule comprises long fibres (fibres as long or longer than the granule), short fibres or fibrous material of different shapes. The granules comprizing fillers (e.g. powder) are classified in  . Illustrative example of subject matter classified in  .

title: Auxiliary treatment of granules
informative_references: Macromolecular compounds obtained by reactions forming a carboxylic ester link in the main chain of the macromoleculeSolid-state polycondensationPost-polymerisation treatmentPurification; DryingMacromolecular compounds obtained by reactions forming a carboxylic amide link in the main chain of the macromoleculeSolid state polycondensationPost-polymerisation treatmentMachines or apparatus for drying materials in loose, plastic, or fluidised form, e.g. granules, staple fibres, with progressive movement
definition_statement: This place covers: The methods and devices for the after-treatment of granules, pellets made of plastic material (e.g. absorbing, coating, crystallizing, deforming, purifying). The chemical aspect of the treatment of granules (e.g. post-polymerization, polycondensation) is classifiyed in  . Illustrative example of subject matter classified in  .

title: Making preforms  (B29C61/06 takes precedence {; combined with blow-moulding B29C49/02, with thermoforming B29C51/02; making preforms for manufacturing of light guides B29D11/00721})
informative_references: F-term (Japanese classification) related to making preforms4F201/BM00
special_rules: The making of preforms (process and apparatus) for which an entry is provided elsewhere, e.g. , is not classified in  and its subgroups.However, the indexing of preforms for blow-moulding bottles using the coding scheme under  is obligatory when the structure of the preform differs from the conventional shape (one layer, open neck, flange, cylindrical body, closed semispherical end).
glossary_of_terms: PreformAn object obtained by moulding substantially consisting of plastic material, which has to undergo an additional processing step, e.g. blow moulding, to obtain its final shape
definition_statement: This place covers: Preforms relating to   in general. Preforms for blow-moulding bottles. Making of preforms not otherwise provided for.

title: by dividing preformed material, e.g. sheets, rods
informative_references: F-term (Japanese classification) related to manufacturing preforms by shredding preformed materials 4F201/BM01

title: by assembling preformed material
informative_references: Joining of preformed parts F-term (Japanese classification) related to manufacturing preforms by assembling preformed materials 4F201/BM02
definition_statement: This place covers: Making preforms by assembling separate parts, e.g. making a perform for blow moulding by joining a separately moulded neck and thread portion with a separately moulded body portion.

title: by moulding the material
informative_references: F-term (Japanese classification) related to manufacturing preforms by moulding the materials 4F201/BM04

title: Injection moulding
informative_references: F-term (Japanese classification) related to manufacturing preforms by injection moulding 4F201/BM05
special_rules: Injection moulding processes and devices for making preforms, whereby the alleged invention lies in the moulding technique as such, are classified in the moulding technique as such () and not in this subgroup.

title: Extrusion moulding
informative_references: F-term (Japanese classification) related to manufacturing preforms by extrusion moulding 4F201/BM06
special_rules: Extrusion moulding processes and devices for making preforms, whereby the alleged invention lies in the moulding technique as such, are classified in the moulding technique () as such and not in this subgroup.

title: Compression moulding
informative_references: F-term (Japanese classification) related to manufacturing preforms by compression moulding 4F201/BM07
special_rules: Compression moulding processes and devices for making preforms, whereby the alleged invention lies in the moulding technique as such, are classified in the moulding technique () as such and not in this subgroup.

title: characterised by structure or composition
informative_references: F-term (Japanese classification) related to:Shapes, structures4F201/BM12F-term (Japanese classification) related to:Layered structures4F201/BM13F-term (Japanese classification) related to:Compositions, properties4F201/BM14
special_rules: The indexing of preforms for blow-moulding bottles using the coding scheme under  is obligatory when the structure of the preform differs from the conventional shape (one layer, open neck, flange, cylindrical body, closed semispherical end).
definition_statement: This place covers: Preforms having a special composition or shape adapted for its further processing steps or use.

title: comprising fillers or reinforcement {(non-woven fabrics per se D04H1/00, D04H3/00)}
informative_references: Shaping composites F-term (Japanese classification) related to: Preforms, including shaping thereof4F072/AG00F-term (Japanese classification) related to: Manufacturing preforms4F072/AH00
definition_statement: This place covers: Preforms having fillers/reinforcement where the purpose of subsequent moulding is mentioned

title: Conditioning or physical treatment of the material to be shaped  (chemical aspects C08J3/00 {; heating, cooling or curing during shaping B29C35/00; thermal after-treatment B29C71/02})
definition_statement: This place covers: The methods and devices for the pre-treatment of the plastic material to be shaped prior to the moulding operation. Illustrative example of subject matter classified in  . JP59096134 DE1479034 A1

title: {Treatment of sinter powders}
definition_statement: This place covers: The methods and devices for the pre-treatment of powder plastic material prior to the process of sintering. Illustrative example of subject matter classified in  .

title: {Heat treatment of powders}
definition_statement: This place covers: The methods and devices for the pre-treatment of the plastic material to be shaped (powder, pellets, granules) by heating prior to the moulding operation. Illustrative example of subject matter classified in  .

title: {Melting the material to be shaped}
informative_references: Storage, supply or control of liquid or other fluent material; provided with means for heating or cooling the liquid or other fluent material in the supplying means upstream of the applying apparatus
definition_statement: This place covers: The methods and devices for the heat treatment of the plastic material to be shaped (powder, pellets, granules) until said plastic material melts prior to the moulding operation. Illustrative example of subject matter classified in  . US2207426

title: {Half-products, e.g. films, plates}
definition_statement: This place covers: The methods and devices for the pre-treatment by heating of the plastic material to be shaped, said plastic material typically being in the form of a film or plate. Said film or plate is a half-product as it has not yet undergone its final shaping operation. Illustrative example of subject matter classified in  .

informative_references: Processes of treating or compounding macromolecular substances. Treatment by wave energy or particle radiationIrradiation devices

title: by grinding, e.g. by triturating; by sieving; by filtering
informative_references: Recovery of plastics or other constituents of waste material containing plastics. Disintegrating plastics (e.g. by milling)Disintegrating by knives or other cutting or tearing members which chop material into fragments, specially adapted for disintegrating plastics,
definition_statement: This place covers: The methods and devices for the mechanical pre-treatment of the plastic material to be shaped by grinding prior to the moulding operation. Illustrative example of subject matter classified in  .

title: Pretreatment of the material to be shaped, not covered by groups B29B7/00 - B29B13/00
definition_statement: This place covers: The methods and devices wherein the material undergoes a pre-treatment operation that is an operation that modifies the material to be shaped e.g. by moulding. Illustrative example of subject matter classified in  .

title: Coagulating devices
informative_references: Treatment of rubber latex, coagulationTreatment of polymer emulsions, coagulation
definition_statement: This place covers: The methods and devices wherein the material undergoes a coagulation operation prior to final shaping wherein the mechanical aspect of the method or device is detailed.

title: of reinforcements or fillers  (chemical aspects C08J, C08K)
definition_statement: This place covers: Surface modifications, normally chemical but also treatments like preheating or carving, of reinforcements or fillers typically to improve the adhesion with the matrix

title: {of reinforcement of definite length with a matrix in solid form, e.g. powder, fibre or sheet form  (calendering B29C70/506)}
informative_references: Treatments of textile materials by liquids, gases or vapoursArtificial leather obtained by covering fibrous webs with macromolecular material

title: {with a matrix in liquid form, e.g. as melt, solution or latex}
informative_references: Matrix in powder formMatrix in the form of sheet

title: Recovery of plastics or other constituents of waste material containing plastics;  ({volume reduction of waste plastics, e.g. by mechanical compacting or melting disposal of solid waste B09B;} chemical recovery C08J11/00)
informative_references: General arrangement of separating plants for refuseVolume reduction of waste plastics other than plastic containers
special_rules: In this group including its subgroups, it is highly desirable to add the Indexing Codes  for the type of plastic material to be recycled, and the Indexing Codes  for the type of product to be recycled.In this group including its subgroups, only the type of plastic material to be recycled shall be classified by the  Indexing Codes. Any non-recycled material, e.g. virgin material, which is added during the recycling process shall not be classified by such  Indexing Codes.
definition_statement: This place covers: Processes as well as the corresponding machinery for recovering plastics, as well as other constituents of waste material containining plastics

title: {Direct recuperation and re-use of scrap material during moulding operation, i.e. feed-back of used material}
informative_references: Recovery of starting material, waste material or solvents during the manufacture of artificial filaments or the like, made of synthetic polymers
definition_statement: This place covers: Recycling processes, as well as the corresponing machinery, whereby the recovery of plastics is combined with the direct reuse of said material in a molding process. Typical examples are: Re-use by regrinding the hardened runner/sprue and feeding it into the hopper of an injection moulding machine. Re-use by regrinding or directly feeding the side-trim in plastic film extrusion to the hopper of the extruder.

title: {by agglomeration or compacting}
informative_references: Dietetic products with reduced nutritive value, by addition of substantially indigestible substances, i.e. Cellulose or derivativesMaking particle boards or fibreboards, with preformed covering layerMaking discontinuous sheets of paper, pulpboard or cardboard, or of wet web, for fibreboard production

title: {of large particles, e.g. beads, granules, pellets, flakes, slices}
informative_references: Making granules

title: {for shaping parts, e.g. multilayered parts with at least one layer containing regenerated plastic}
informative_references: Destroying solid waste or transforming solid waste by agglomeration, binding or encapsulation using an organic binder or matrix Layered products essentially comprising synthetic resin made from or containing mainly scrap material
special_rules: In this group, it is highly recommended to add additional classification in the shaping technique concerned, e.g.  for compression moulding,  for injection moulding.
definition_statement: This place covers: Recovery of plastics or other constituents of waste material containing plastics by an agglomeration or compacting process. The recovered material is used for shaping parts, e.g. compacting plastic waste particles in a heated compression mould for obtaining a discrete article. Possibly with the addition of a binding agent, i.e. urethane.

title: {Compacting complete waste articles}
definition_statement: This place covers: Recovery of plastics or other constituents of waste material containing plastics by an agglomeration or compacting process, whereby a complete wasted article is compacted, e.g. recovery of plastic containers, e.g. PET bottles by volume reduction.

title: {Hollow articles, e.g. bottles}
informative_references: Presses specially adapted for consolidating scrap metal or for compacting used cars

title: Separating plastics from other materials
informative_references: Separating by pneumatic tables or by pneumatic jigsWet separating by sink-float separation
definition_statement: This place covers: Recovery of plastics or other constituents of waste material containing plastics whereby said recovered material is separated from other materials, e.g. one type of plastics, e.g. PE is seperated from another type of plastics, e.g. PA, by density separation in a water bath.

title: {using local heating of the reinforcement}
definition_statement: This place covers: Recovery of plastics or other constituents of waste material containing plastics whereby the matrix material is separated selectively from the reinforcements by destroying the interface bound before desintegrating the matrix to particles or powder using local heating of the reinforcement, e.g. heating of tires or conveyor belts, e.g. by induction heating, for softening the rubber matrix around the then hot steel wires.

title: Disintegrating plastics, {e.g. by milling} (B29B9/02, B29B11/02, B29B13/10, {B29B17/02} take precedence)
informative_references: Disintegrating by knives or other cutting or tearing members which chop material into fragmentsEspecially adapted for disintegrating plastics, e.g. cinematographic filmsFor plastic bottlesCutting through work characterised by the nature or movement of the cutting member; Apparatus or machines therefor; Cutting members thereforEspecially adapted for cutting rubber For cutting used tyres
special_rules: In this group including its undergroups, it is highly desirable to add additional  Indexing Codes for the type of disintegrating technique.
definition_statement: This place covers: Processes as well as the corresponding machinery for recovering plastics, as well as other constituents of waste material containining plastics, whereby the plastic material is disintegrated.
